Sentencas: One challenge for the commercial development of solid oxide fuel cells as efficient energy-conversion devices isthermo-mechanical instability.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Large internal-strain gradients caused by the mismatch in thermal expansion behaviour between different fuel cell components are the main cause of this instability, which can lead to cell degradation, delamination or fracture(1-4).
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Here we demonstrate an approach to realizing full thermo-mechanical compatibility between the cathode and other cell components by introducing a thermal-expansion offset.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: We use reactive sintering to combine a cobalt-based perovskite with high electrochemical activity and large thermal-expansion coefficient with a negative-thermal-expansion material, thus forming a composite electrode with a thermal-expansion behaviour that is well matched to that of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: A new interphase is formed because of the limited reaction between the two materials in the composite during the calcination process, which also creates A-site deficiencies in the perovskite.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: As a result, the composite shows both high activity and excellent stability.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: The introduction of reactive negative-thermal-expansion components may provide a general strategy for the development of fully compatible and highly active electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes
